events.message: The policyholder reported an auto accident that occurred on the morning of April 30, involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
After initial review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of the car collision and damages provided.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this claim, responsible for guiding the claimant through the next steps and documentation process.
The claimant received official acknowledgment of the claim submission and confirmation that the process had begun.
The insurance company requested additional documents including photos of the vehicle damage, a police report, and repair estimates.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos of the front bumper damage and the official police collision report.
The claims department began a thorough investigation to validate the submitted evidence and assess the extent of vehicle damages.
The investigation was completed confirming that the claimant was not at fault for the accident, and the damage assessment was finalized.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the vehicle repairs up to the policy limits, reflecting the repair shop's estimate.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and promptly approved the amount to proceed with repairs.
Following approval from the claimant, the insurance company officially approved the claim for payment.
The payment for vehicle repair costs was issued to the repair shop as per the approved settlement agreement.
The claim was formally closed after confirmation that the automobile repairs were completed and the claimant was satisfied.
All documents and communications related to this auto accident claim were archived securely according to company policy.
